sen.j: この寺は、平安時代後鳥羽上皇が鳥羽殿（鳥羽離宮・現在伏見区中島）に建てた阿弥陀堂に始まると伝えられる。
sen.e: This temple is reported to have originated in the Amida-do Hall (a temple hall having an enshrined image of Amitabha) which was built in the Heian Period by the retired Emperor Gotoba in the Toba-dono Palace which is also known as the Toba-rikyu (Toba detatched palace) in the current place of Nakajima, Fushimi Ward.

sen.j: 鳥羽殿の衰退とともに阿弥陀堂も衰えたが、浄土宗の僧長西（1184年～1228年）が復興し、1471年（文明 (日本)3年）現在の地に移された。
sen.e: Along with the aging Toba-dono Palace, Amida-do Hall became also decrepit, but it was restored by Chosai, a monk of Jodo Sect during the years of 1184 through 1228, and it was eventually shifted to the present site in 1471.

sen.j: 寺運は衰えたが、江戸時代にはいり袋中（1552年～1639年）が入寺して中興された。
sen.e: Although the fate of this temple went on declining, it was restored in the Edo Period by Taichu (1552～1639) who entered this temple as a priest.
